basics.name: John Boen
basics.label: Senior Database & AI Engineer
basics.summary: Seasoned senior data engineer with 25+ years of experience designing and implementing client-server applications and reporting systems. Strong grounding in Agile/Scrum/6 Sigma. Passionate lifelong learner and mentor. Current learning focus is on Large Language Models and agentic software.

work.name: Google (Google Core ML) (Contingent Staff: Artech LLC)
work.summary: Created and modified data workflows, built reporting on new datasets, and introduced a disciplined software-lifecycle approach for Google’s Core ML analytics.
highlights: Consolidated dozens of ad-hoc data/reporting jobs into a version-controlled, multi-environment pipeline with dependency management, retry logic, and alerting.
Performed large-scale statistical analyses (e.g., Inter-Rater Reliability, skew assessments) to identify similarity clusters across data cohorts.
projects: Rater Reliability Analysis: Built statistical models to evaluate consistency across human evaluators
Automated Alerting System: Created a comprehensive monitoring system for data quality issues
SDLC: Implemented a multi-environment pipeline for data processing and reporting

work.name: Virtuoso Inc.
work.summary: Implemented new data/reporting solutions and provided rapid triage for critical data corrections within global travel systems.
highlights: Designed stored-procedure interfaces and analytics for luxury-travel booking platforms.
Led emergency data-repair efforts that restored production accuracy within hours.

work.name: Prior Experience Summary (Pre-2015)
work.summary: Prior Experience Summary (Pre-2015): My early career spans two decades across prominent organizations including Microsoft (1996-2004), Getty Images (2004-2007), Ripl Corp (2007-2008), Virtuoso (2008-2009), and Demand Media (2009-2014), with foundational roles at Boeing (1991-1995). Throughout these positions, I developed expertise in data warehousing, database application design, predictive analytics infrastructure, enterprise system scalability, and fault-tolerant data systems. I consistently delivered robust solutions for high-profile platforms including WindowsMedia.com, MSN, Xbox, global imagery catalogs, and Internet domain registries, while advancing from individual contributor to leadership roles and mentoring technical teams.

work.name: Demand Media
work.summary: Built the data-infrastructure layer for a fault-tolerant Internet registry managing millions of domains.

work.name: Virtuoso Inc. (Contingent Staff: Self-employed)
work.summary: Redesigned cruise-market subsystems during enterprise consolidation, improving scalability and feature velocity.

work.name: Ripl Corp
work.summary: Created data infrastructure enabling predictive analytics for early-stage social-media trend detection.

work.name: Getty Images
work.summary: Designed database applications that powered sales and marketing analytics across global imagery catalogs.

work.name: Microsoft Corporation
work.position: Software Development Engineer → Database Engineer → Manager
work.summary: Drove large-scale projects using pre-release Microsoft technologies; built data warehouses for WindowsMedia.com, MSN, Xbox, and subscription services.
highlights: Pioneered reporting environments that became blueprints for later Microsoft web properties.

work.name: Microsoft IT (Contingent Staff: Volt Computer contracts)
work.summary: Developed and supported internal LOB applications (patent tracking, HR, finance) for Microsoft.

work.name: Boeing Commercial Airplanes
work.summary: Managed change-management and design-coordination processes; built decision-support and workflow tools for aircraft programs.
